content.data: Generating +LabelOutput
Label.png
+Labeloutput is all generated on the S2M CENTER station. The process is outlined below:

Click on  Utilities Tab | +LabelSetup . 
 
 
 The first tab upon entering +LabelSetup is Jobs. This screen shows currently active and inactive +Labeljobs. You can remove any of these jobs from the system by simply clicking the check box
        beside the job and clicking the "Remove Selected Jobs" button.
Click on  Utilities Tab | +LabelSetup .
Click on  Utilities Tab | +LabelSetup .

The first tab upon entering +LabelSetup is Jobs. This screen shows currently active and inactive +Labeljobs. You can remove any of these jobs from the system by simply clicking the check box
        beside the job and clicking the "Remove Selected Jobs" button.

The first tab upon entering +LabelSetup is Jobs. This screen shows currently active and inactive +Labeljobs. You can remove any of these jobs from the system by simply clicking the check box
        beside the job and clicking the "Remove Selected Jobs" button.
image368.png

You can also select the Job Type from the Jobs Tab. The first option is "Linked (Small)" this +Label
    Job type requires the  psnc.mdb database  file be located in the same folder that you are outputting the +Label Job to. The second option "Self-Contained (Large)"
    creates a stand-alone +Label file that can be used on any +Label station and does not require a machine database for support. Although a bit larger it is the most stable +Label job file as it contains your Label designs and requires no linking back
    to the S2M CENTER.
Information.png
An additional capability is the ability to control the Unit of Measure for the +Label. Click the Unit of Measure buttons at the lower left to control this.
Information.png
Click OK to exit +Label Setup.
Click OK to exit +Label Setup.
Click OK to exit +Label Setup.

Optimize your jobs as you normally would. 
 
 
 Once on the Pattern screen, output your NC instructions as normal. 
 
 
 Enable the "Output to +Label" option. Type in the name of the +Label job. You may want to give the job a name that will tie back to your job name or number. This is the name the +Label  operator    will select
        to start processing the job.
Optimize your jobs as you normally would.
Optimize your jobs as you normally would.
Once on the Pattern screen, output your NC instructions as normal.
Once on the Pattern screen, output your NC instructions as normal.

Enable the "Output to +Label" option. Type in the name of the +Label job. You may want to give the job a name that will tie back to your job name or number. This is the name the +Label  operator    will select
        to start processing the job.

Enable the "Output to +Label" option. Type in the name of the +Label job. You may want to give the job a name that will tie back to your job name or number. This is the name the +Label  operator    will select
        to start processing the job.
image370.png
Click on Run.
Click on Run.
Click on Run.
You have now successfully output to the +Label Station. See the Topic on " Using +Labelin Production " to learn how to access and use this output.
